translation.text: Four rikchiks keep safe by looking out for danger.
A family or household. Specifically, its adult members.
A house, in the sense of an object.
To marry, either creating a new family or adding one or more members to an existing family.
A house, in the sense of a place.
The idea of home or marriage.
The rikchik or rikchiks determining that the rikchiks be married.
The leaders of Long-Tree marry their child to the leaders of Summer-Insect.
Any means used to enact the home.
An individual member of the family.
The ratio between a circle's perimeter and its diameter: approximately 3.1 or 30.663652.
An establishing phrase, describing an event taking place before the sequence (such as "once upon a time" or "last week at work").
A length of time between events.
A closing phrase, describing an event that takes place after the sequence (such as "they all lived happily ever after").
A printed or otherwise physical word.
To give birth; to begin to do something.
The parent; the entity beginning the action.
A contributor; any assisting entity or object.
The child produced; the action begun.

One of the non-Parent sources of genetic material to a child in rikchik-like reproduction. (Rikchiks and other animals in the rikchik biosphere reproduce by having some number N (at least 1) of Contributors each provide 1/2N of their genes to a child, while the Parent provides the remaining half and gives birth to the child.)
To take the Contributor role in rikchik-like reproduction; more generally, to contribute something to a common pool.
Southern-East: the direction 1/3 of the way from East to South.
Northern-East: the direction 1/3 of the way from East to North.
The thoughts or beliefs being thought.
The entity that is less large (or less Quality) than the Patient.
The quality in which the Patient is more than the Agent.
The entity that is more large (or more Quality) than the Patient.
Complete or closed (as a circle or path).
A reading-lens (a foot-wide lens used to read small print).
Being as old as the span.
A means used to measure the span.
The events that took place during the span. The span is defined as being as long as these events were taking place.
A unit of time equal to 49 water-spans, or 96 Earth minutes.
About as old as a fire-span.
A unit of time equal to 23 rikchik days, or 21.5 Earth days.
About as old as a block.
A unit of time equal to 64 or 65 years, or 80 Earth years. One orbit of Friend Sun (Alpha Centauri B) around Sun (Alpha Centauri A).
About as old as a cycle.
No amount of time, an instant.
A unit of time equal to 21 blocks or 483 days (plus a leap day every 19 years) or 1.24 Earth years. One rikchik planetary year.
About as old as a year.
A named day of the week.
Season (usually one of 3: Flower Season, Fire Season, or Sleep Season)
A unit of time equal to 7 cycles, 472 rikchik years, or 560 Earth years.
About as old as a great cycle.
A unit of time equal to 14 fire-spans, or 22.45 Earth hours. One rikchik planetary day.
About as old as a day.
A unit of time equal to 49 rock-spans, or 118 earth seconds.
About as old as a water-span.
A unit of time equal to 7 rikchik days, or 6.5 Earth days.
About as old as a week.
A unit of time equal to 2.4 Earth seconds.
About as old as a rock-span.
A small rock, such as the ones thrown to get someone's attention.
To get the attention of someone facing another direction by throwing a small rock at them; more generally, to throw.
A unit of length, nicknamed a 'throw', 21 'reaches' long. About 40 yards or 35 meters.
One of a selection of animate entities (often translated "Or").
One of a selection of inanimate entities (often translated "Or").
Fruit or vegetables on the vine.
Counter-clockwise around a circular area, especially a city.
Six divided by two is three.
The entities among which the Patient is shared.
To want something; to want to do something.
A toddler is a small animal with a simple body supported by seven spindly legs, a front-mounted mouth, and an eye on a stalk.
The water-toddler is a relative of the toddler. It is a water creature with a bottom-mounted mouth.
Rollers (sphaera sphaera) are spherical creatures, with 98 small tentacles all over their body. The rikchik-sized rollers eat grass, bushes, and rocks in the grasslands.
A lesser roller (sphaera minor) is a rodent-sized roller which eats grass and pebbles in grasslands and forests.
A greater roller (sphaera major) is a mammoth-sized roller which eats trees and boulders in grasslands, forests, canyons, and foothills.
To be similar to, to resemble in some way
The quality shared by the patients and agents.
The object that is similar to other objects in the Patient or Agent roles.
The act of exchanging objects with someone; buying; barter.
The other entity in the transaction; the seller.
The object given up; the currency used to buy.
The object exchanged for; the bought item.
The entity initiating the transaction; the buyer.
To die; to kill; to stop doing.
The dead entity; the stopped activity.
Eastern-North: the direction 1/3 of the way from North to East.
Western-North: the direction 1/3 of the way from North to West.
A god; usually one of the Seven Gods.
Western-South: the direction 1/3 of the way from South to West.
Eastern-South: the direction 1/3 of the way from South to East.
A human being (homo sapiens); occasionally the human being spoken to (parallel to Rikchik-R). In some contexts, any alien.
Human culture and terrestrial biology in general.
A rikchik (ilpes sapiens); generically, any thinking creature; occasionally, the entity being spoken to or the entity reading the text.
Mainstream Rikchik culture, including the Rikchik language and Heptatheism.
The reason for talking. The subject being discussed or explained.
The videance (the entity being talked to).
Please say that again. (Literally, "Speak the previous speak.")
The information or ability that is learned.
Globe-paint (the primary rikchik form of adornment).
The rikchik wearing the paint. The object being painted on.
A rikchik's eye widens in happiness.
A chimp (ilpes arborealis), a forest-dwelling creature that resembles a rikchik but has a non-shperical globe.
The grass-crawler has a small body with a front-facing mouth, seven long, flat legs, and an eye on a very long stalk that allows it to see over the tall grasses that it lives in.
To transfer something from one entity to another; to give; to take; to allow to do.
The entity from which the Patient is taken.
The entity to which the Patient is given.
The object given; the allowed activity.
Blue. Also includes turquoise, cyan, and bluish purples.

A dragon, a mythical creature. Dragons are said to be like sky-fish, but colored like sunsets or storms instead of blue sky, and with a large spike above their eye. They are said to reside inside storms and to send down lightning.
Southern-West: the direction 1/3 of the way from West to South.
Northern-West: the direction 1/3 of the way from West to North.
A unit of length, nicknamed a 'walk', 1372 'throws' long. About 30 miles or 50 km.
A non-moving entity causing the movement.
A vehicle or path used for the movement.
Crabs are small water animals that have a top-mounted eye, a bottom-mounted mouth, and seven small, stubby legs surrounding the mouth.

A lumpy-beast (glaebifer vastitaticolus), a mountain/forest creature that resembles a lumpy globe with a tentacle coming out of each lump (98 tentacles total), with a single forward-facing eye and a rear-facing mouth.

Pulsers are small ocean animals with a mouth at one end, an eye at the other, and nothing much in between. They wriggle through water with a pulsing motion. They are commonly believed to be some of the most primitive animals on the planet.
To have; to be able to do
The object or ability that is had
To love, to be attracted to.
Feelings of love; in scientific contexts, gravity.
The loving entity; the entity being attracted.
The loved entity; the attracting entity.
The object being affected by magnetism.
The globe of a rikchik body.
A dead globe; a spherical thing.
A planet, as an object in the sky.
A tentacle or other extremity of a living creature (such as an arm or tail).
A dead tentacle or other extremity of an inanimate object (such as a leaf or an outcropping).
To touch or point at something.
A unit of length, nicknamed a 'reach', 7 'blades' long. About 5.5 feet or 1.6 meters.
A collection of animate entities (often translated "And").

A bouncer (prosaltor ferox) a carnivore which has a long body ending in a mouth, a eye on a finlike appendage above the body, six powerful straight jumping legs, and a flat tail it uses for guidance. It hunts in the grasslands and lower mountains.
Clockwise around a circular area, especially a city.
To be across something, or to cross something. In math, the square root operation.
Similar to the morpheme for Spot.
Miscellaneous small annoying animals. None have wings, though a few can glide on leaves or are naturally buoyant.
To do nothing, to not do something. Often used as part of the "please" construction.

Fish is a general term for a family of similar-looking sea and water creatures. They all have a flattish, conical head/body, which bears a forward-facing eye and a downward-facing mouth, which is surrounded by extremely strong dangling tentacles. Fish have control over their buoyancy, like a submarine. Fish eat sea plants, minerals, and small water animals. They are representatives of the most primitive animals on the rikchik homeworld to be able to eat minerals.
The sky-fish is a large animal that resembles a hot-air balloon. It floats in the sky, mostly living on insects, and occasionally drifting down to eat foliage and gnaw on mountain peaks.
The physical objects involved in a game.
The people or goods being transported.
A unit of length, nicknamed a 'blade', about 9.5 inches or 24 centimeters.
In math, multiplying a number by itself.
In math, the argument of the circling operation.
An award or any recognition for excelling in a contest, such as a race.
A creature in the state. Apposite to the patient role.
A thing in the state. Apposite to the patient role.
The entity, if different from the patient, causing the state.
Used for numbers and other mathematical concepts.
Used for morphemes expressing a relation between two or more other words. Takes the place of prepositions in many other languages.
The entity to which the patient is in the relation.
Used for animals and other things with the power of motion.
Used for substances of which other items are constructed.
A creature taking the V action. Apposite to the Agent role.
The entity the action is taken on.
The tool. Apposite to the instrument relation.
To take action similar to use of the tool.
The entity, if different from the patient, using the tool.
The entity being affected by the tool.
The emotion in the abstract; the "vibes" of the emotion.
Used for morphemes that have a primarily grammatical function.
Animate Noun: used for living things and self-propelled machinery.
Inanimate Noun: used for non-living things, including dead things.
Name: replaces the form in a descriptive name to mark it as a name.
Idea: any non-tangible noun that is not a place.
A circle, or the circling operation.
